function:
def modify_features(df_input) -> pd.DataFrame:
    """
    Thought 1: The absolute difference between Left-Weight and Right-Weight can capture the imbalance in weight distribution.
    New Feature 1: weight_difference | weight_difference = abs(Left-Weight - Right-Weight)
    """
    import pandas as pd
    import numpy as np
    """Improved version of `modify_features_v1`.
    
    Thought 1: The residual between left and right weights might indicate the balance distribution more effectively.
    New Feature 10: weight_residual | weight_residual = Residual(Left-Weight, Right-Weight)
    
    Thought 2: The residual between left and right distances could also reveal insights into the balance scale.
    New Feature 11: distance_residual | distance_residual = Residual(Left-Distance, Right-Distance)
    
    Thought 3: The mean weight and mean distance values might provide information on the overall weight distribution.
    New Feature 12: mean_weight | mean_weight = Round((Left-Weight + Right-Weight) / 2)
    New Feature 13: mean_distance | mean_distance = Round((Left-Distance + Right-Distance) / 2)
    """
    
    df_output = df_input.copy()
    
    # Feature: Residual between left and right weights
    df_output['weight_residual'] = np.abs(df_output['Left-Weight'] - df_output['Right-Weight'])
    
    # Feature: Residual between left and right distances
    df_output['distance_residual'] = np.abs(df_output['Left-Distance'] - df_output['Right-Distance'])
    
    # Feature: Mean weight and mean distance
    df_output['mean_weight'] = np.round((df_output['Left-Weight'] + df_output['Right-Weight']) / 2)
    df_output['mean_distance'] = np.round((df_output['Left-Distance'] + df_output['Right-Distance']) / 2)
    
    return df_output
